definitions: A man in relation to his child or children.
A male animal in relation to its offspring.
An important male figure in the origin and early history of something.
A man who provides care and protection.
The oldest member or doyen of a society or other body.
(in Christian belief) the first person of the Trinity; God.
Used as a title of respect for an old and venerable man or for something personified as such a man.
(often as a title or form of address) a priest.
Early Christian theologians (in particular of the first five centuries) whose writings are regarded as especially authoritative.
